titleInfo.title: Fleet Systems, Inc. v. Federal Coach
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND OPINION regarding plaintiff's motion for a temporary restraining order; an Injunction in accordance with this Memorandum Opinion will issue this date.Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (PCV, )

extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND OPINION regarding plaintiff's motion for a temporary restraining order; an Injunction in accordance with this Memorandum Opinion will issue this date.Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (PCV, )

titleInfo.title: Fleet Systems, Inc. v. Federal Coach
titleInfo.subTitle: TEMPORARY INJUNCTION regarding Memorandum and Order18; IT IS ORDERED: Federal Coach is hereby enjoined from terminating, cancelling, or altering the terms of the parties' Agreement dated November 24, 1992; Federal Coach shall continue the customs, practices and course of dealing that it applied to the 2006 Agreement; it shall apply a deal discount to all sales of Federal Coach vehicles to Fleet Systems, Inc. in an amount comparable to that applied to invoices governed by the 2006 contract and no sales specific territorial marketing assessments shall be applied to Fleet's sales; pursuant to Fed.R.Civ.P.65(c), Fleet Systems, Inc. shall furnish a bond in the amount of $31,500.00. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (PCV, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cv-00008; Fleet Systems, Inc. v. Federal Coach;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: TEMPORARY INJUNCTION regarding Memorandum and Order18; IT IS ORDERED: Federal Coach is hereby enjoined from terminating, cancelling, or altering the terms of the parties' Agreement dated November 24, 1992; Federal Coach shall continue the customs, practices and course of dealing that it applied to the 2006 Agreement; it shall apply a deal discount to all sales of Federal Coach vehicles to Fleet Systems, Inc. in an amount comparable to that applied to invoices governed by the 2006 contract and no sales specific territorial marketing assessments shall be applied to Fleet's sales; pursuant to Fed.R.Civ.P.65(c), Fleet Systems, Inc. shall furnish a bond in the amount of $31,500.00. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (PCV, )

titleInfo.title: Fleet Systems, Inc. v. Federal Coach
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - This matter is before the court following the hearing on the motion for a preliminary injunction held before Chief Judge Bataillon on 3/27/07. The parties will meet and confer in accordance with Fed. R. Civ. P. 26(f) and file a report of such conference on or before 4/24/07. The undersigned magistrate judge will hold a planning conference with counsel for all parties on 4/30/07 at 9:30a.m. Counsel for plaintiff shall initiate the telephone conference. Rule 26 Meeting Report Deadline set for 4/24/2007. Telephone Planning Conference set for 4/30/2007 09:30 AM before Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: Fleet Systems, Inc. v. Federal Coach
titleInfo.subTitle: INJUNCTION regarding Memorandum and Order, 53; IT IS ORDERED: Federal Coach is hereby enjoined from terminating, cancelling, or altering theterms of the parties Agreement dated November 24, 1992. Federal Coach shall continue the customs, practices and course of dealing that it applied to the 2006 Agreement; it shall apply a dealer discount to all sales of FederalCoach vehicles to Fleet Systems, Inc. in an amount comparable to that applied to invoices governed by the 2006 contract and no sales specific territorial marketing assessments shall be applied to Fleets sales. This injunction shall remain in force and effect until November 24, 2007. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (PCV, )

titleInfo.title: Fleet Systems, Inc. v. Federal Coach
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - 1. Defendant's withdrawal of Filing No. 56 is granted; 2. The injunction entered in accordance with the court's previous Memorandum Opinion, Filing Nos. 53&54, is ordered to continue and remain in place subject to the terms set forth herein; 3. Plaintiff's motion for temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction 88 is denied as moot; 4. Defendant's motion for leave to file supplemental evidence, Filing No. 91, is granted and deemed filed instanter. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (KBJ) Modified on 8/20/2007 to edit text to reflect the correct Judge that signed this Order (KBJ).

titleInfo.title: Fleet Systems, Inc. v. Federal Coach
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - IT IS ORDERED that: 1. The parties shall file a joint stipulation for dismissal (or other dispositive stipulation) with the clerk of the court which will fully dispose of the case on or before November 5, 2007. If the case is being dismissed, the stipulation shall comply with Fed. R. Civ. P. 41(a)(1)(ii) and shall state whether the dismissal is with or without prejudice.2. Absent compliance with this order, this case (including all counterclaims and the like) may be dismissed without further notice in accordance with NECivR 68.1. 3. The deadlines and hearing dates previously scheduled are cancelled upon the representation that this case is settled. 4. The defendants appeal from the magistrate judges order 99 isdeemed withdrawn and the appeal may be termed on the docket. ***Set/Reset All Deadlines: Dismissal Papers Deadline due by 11/5/2007.Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (PCV, )

titleInfo.title: Fleet Systems, Inc. v. Federal Coach
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 124 Stipulation; This case, including without limitation all claims and counterclaims, is dismissed without prejudice; Each party will bear its own attorneys fees, expenses, and costs in connection with this action; The bond filed by Plaintiff (Filing No. 20), is released, and Defendant shall not make any claim on that bond; and All Temporary Injunctions, Temporary Restraining Orders, Preliminary Injunctions, and other Injunctions entered in this case, including without limitation Filings No. 19 and 54, are terminated. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (ADB)

Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (ADB)

titleInfo.title: Fleet Systems, Inc. v. Federal Coach
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Pursuant to NECivR 79.1(f) or NECrimR 55.1(g), counsel for the parties shall either 1) withdraw the following exhibits previously submitted in this matter within 15 calendar days of the date of this order, or 2) show cause why the exhibits should not be destroyed; If counsel fails to withdraw these exhibits as directed or to show cause why the exhibits should not be destroyed, the clerk's office is directed to destroy the listed exhibitswithout further notice to the parties or order from the court.Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (TJS)
